segments.content: # This Week In React - Curator Job
segments.sourceMdx: # This Week In React - Curator Job
segments.translated_content: # This Week In React - 内容策展人招募

segments.content: I initially created [This Week In React](https://thisweekinreact.com/) as a curation newsletter helping React devs stay up-to-date with ecosystem news.
segments.sourceMdx: I initially created [This Week In React](https://thisweekinreact.com/) as a curation newsletter helping React devs stay up-to-date with ecosystem news.
segments.translated_content: 我最初创建[This Week In React](https://thisweekinreact.com/)是作为一个帮助React开发者了解生态动态的精选资讯简报。

segments.content: The long-term goal is to become a real community-driven media for React and React Native developers (similar to CSS-Tricks). I’d like it to be more than a weekly email with a list of links.
segments.sourceMdx: The long-term goal is to become a real community-driven media for React and React Native developers (similar to CSS-Tricks). I’d like it to be more than a weekly email with a list of links.
segments.translated_content: 长期目标是将其打造成真正由社区驱动的React和React Native开发者媒体平台（类似CSS-Tricks），而不仅是一份每周链接列表邮件。

segments.content: To do that, I need to delegate, and would like to recruit newsletter collaborators to help me produce the weekly issues.
segments.sourceMdx: To do that, I need to delegate, and would like to recruit newsletter collaborators to help me produce the weekly issues.
segments.translated_content: 为此需要团队协作，现招募简报合作者共同制作每周内容。

segments.content: This is **real work**: you get paid, need to be **reliable**, and be willing to spend **14-18h of work on a single email**.
segments.sourceMdx: This is **real work**: you get paid, need to be **reliable**, and be willing to spend **14-18h of work on a single email**.
segments.translated_content: 这是**正式工作**：有薪酬，要求**高度可靠**，且愿意为每期简报投入**14-18小时工作量**。

segments.content: ## Benefits for This Week In React
segments.sourceMdx: ## Benefits for This Week In React
segments.translated_content: ## 对This Week In React的益处

segments.content: My main goals for this recruitment are:
segments.sourceMdx: My main goals for this recruitment are:
segments.translated_content: 本次招募的主要目标：

segments.content:
* Having a reliable a backup when I take holidays, to avoid burnout
* Making the media look professional with 50+ issues per year
* Making the media more community-driven
* Making the media more diverse by rotating authors
* Freeing up time to develop the media further
* Ensuring the quality of the newsletter stays high
segments.sourceMdx:
- Having a reliable a backup when I take holidays, to avoid burnout
- Making the media look professional with 50+ issues per year
- Making the media more community-driven
- Making the media more diverse by rotating authors
- Freeing up time to develop the media further
- Ensuring the quality of the newsletter stays high
segments.translated_content:
- 建立可靠备份机制，避免因休假导致的倦怠
- 通过每年50+期内容打造专业媒体形象
- 增强社区驱动属性
- 通过作者轮换提升内容多样性
- 腾出时间进行媒体平台深度开发
- 维持简报内容的高质量标准

segments.content: I've been doing this almost alone for five years now, and what was fun at first can become a burden in the long run. I’d like to choose when I want to publish a curation newsletter, instead of being forced to. I’d like to remove myself from the equation so that the project can eventually outlive me.
segments.sourceMdx: I've been doing this almost alone for five years now, and what was fun at first can become a burden in the long run. I’d like to choose when I want to publish a curation newsletter, instead of being forced to. I’d like to remove myself from the equation so that the project can eventually outlive me.
segments.translated_content: 过去五年我几乎独自运营，初期乐趣可能逐渐变成长期负担。我希望能自主选择而非被迫发布内容，最终实现项目能脱离我个人持续运作。

segments.content: ## Benefits for our guest curators
segments.sourceMdx: ## Benefits for our guest curators
segments.translated_content: ## 客座策展人收益

segments.content: The main benefits you get:
segments.sourceMdx: The main benefits you get:
segments.translated_content: 您将获得：

segments.content:
* Being **paid correctly** for each issue sent
* Contributing to your **personal branding** and the **visibility** of your company ([example issue written by guest curators](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/206))
* Giving back to the community, contributing to a useful project
segments.sourceMdx:
- Being **paid correctly** for each issue sent
- Contributing to your **personal branding** and the **visibility** of your company ([example issue written by guest curators](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/206))
- Giving back to the community, contributing to a useful project
segments.translated_content:
- 每期简报的**合理报酬**
- 提升**个人品牌**及公司曝光度（[客座策展人案例](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/206)）
- 回馈社区，参与有价值项目

segments.content: I’m open to discuss the benefits you get if you have fancy ideas. As long as it’s a win-win.
segments.sourceMdx: I’m open to discuss the benefits you get if you have fancy ideas. As long as it’s a win-win.
segments.translated_content: 若有创新提议，欢迎探讨双赢方案。

segments.content: ## The ideal candidate
segments.sourceMdx: ## The ideal candidate
segments.translated_content: ## 理想人选

segments.content: I’m looking for someone who:
segments.sourceMdx: I’m looking for someone who:
segments.translated_content: 我们寻找这样的伙伴：

segments.content:
* **Takes it seriously**, is **super reliable** and willing to do that job in the **long term**.
* Can take **full ownership** of a single email. Remember: I’ll be on holiday and will just be there to hit send! You will be on your own, in my shoes.
* Can comment on **both React and React Native news**, and provide interesting, **senior-level insight**.
* Can spend **\~16h on a single email** once a month. Really, **it’s not a joke**, you can’t do that as a side project and need to **schedule that time** on your agenda.
* Can follow my curation process to find interesting links through various sources (RSS, X, organic…)
* Read the newsletter regularly, and understand the target audience.
* Can follow my editorial line and formatting guides.
* Can communicate properly and simply in English, but it doesn’t need to be perfect and you can use LLMs if you want. I’m not a native speaker and it’s ok.
segments.sourceMdx:
- **Takes it seriously**, is **super reliable** and willing to do that job in the **long term**.
- Can take **full ownership** of a single email. Remember: I’ll be on holiday and will just be there to hit send\! You will be on your own, in my shoes.
- Can comment on **both React and React Native news**, and provide interesting, **senior-level insight**.
- Can spend **\~16h on a single email** once a month. Really, **it’s not a joke**, you can’t do that as a side project and need to **schedule that time** on your agenda.
- Can follow my curation process to find interesting links through various sources (RSS, X, organic…)
- Read the newsletter regularly, and understand the target audience.
- Can follow my editorial line and formatting guides.
- Can communicate properly and simply in English, but it doesn’t need to be perfect and you can use LLMs if you want. I’m not a native speaker and it’s ok.
segments.translated_content:
- **态度严谨**，**高度可靠**且愿意**长期投入**
- 能**全权负责**单期内容（休假期间您将完全自主运作）
- 能对**React和React Native**新闻提供**资深见解**
- 每月能为单期简报投入**约16小时**（需提前预留时间，非业余可完成）
- 能通过RSS、X等多元渠道筛选优质内容
- 定期阅读本刊，理解目标读者群
- 遵循编辑方针和格式规范
- 具备基础英语沟通能力（可使用AI辅助，非母语者亦可）

segments.content: Yes, I’m looking for a 5-legged sheep 😅
segments.sourceMdx: Yes, I’m looking for a 5-legged sheep 😅
segments.translated_content: 是的，我在寻找五条腿的绵羊😅

segments.content: The ideal candidate might not be a single person, but a React service company providing a duo of contributors. The advantages for me:
segments.sourceMdx: The ideal candidate might not be a single person, but a React service company providing a duo of contributors. The advantages for me:
segments.translated_content: 理想情况可能是由React服务公司提供双人团队，优势在于：

segments.content:
* They usually take it seriously, with a long-term marketing vision.
* They know how to manage developers and book the appropriate time in their agendas.
* They can take ownership of an issue and care about their reputation.
* They can provide a stable duo with distinct expertise to cover both React web and React Native
* They can find a backup in case one of them takes holidays or doesn’t want to contribute anymore
segments.sourceMdx:
- They usually take it seriously, with a long-term marketing vision.
- They know how to manage developers and book the appropriate time in their agendas.
- They can take ownership of an issue and care about their reputation.
- They can provide a stable duo with distinct expertise to cover both React web and React Native
- They can find a backup in case one of them takes holidays or doesn’t want to contribute anymore
segments.translated_content:
- 通常更具长期营销视野
- 擅长开发者管理与时间规划
- 重视声誉与责任归属
- 双人互补覆盖Web和Native领域
- 可自主安排备选人员

segments.content: I remain open to individual contributors, but I believe companies are a better fit. I already work with [Theodo Apps](https://apps.theodo.com/) successfully ([example](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/206)).
segments.sourceMdx: I remain open to individual contributors, but I believe companies are a better fit. I already work with [Theodo Apps](https://apps.theodo.com/) successfully ([example](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/206)).
segments.translated_content: 虽也考虑个人申请者，但企业合作更理想。当前已与[Theodo Apps](https://apps.theodo.com/)成功合作（[案例](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/206)）。

segments.content: ## Onboarding
segments.sourceMdx: ## Onboarding
segments.translated_content: ## 入职流程

segments.content: So far, the onboarding has been:
segments.sourceMdx: So far, the onboarding has been:
segments.translated_content: 现行入职流程如下：

segments.content:
* You introduce yourself (or your company’s employees), explain why you think you are a good fit.
* We run a test (paid), and assign you 2 test issues on our [newsletter calendar](https://thisweekinreact.com/calendar), weeks in advance.
* We do an onboarding call so that I can explain the process .
* I give you access to my curation tools to source links (RSS reader).
* We work collaboratively on the 1st test issue so that you get used to the process and understand the subtleties.
* You take full ownership of the 2nd test issue. I’ll answer questions and provide feedback, but you’ll do the majority of the work in autonomy.
* We review the work. It will never be perfect, but If I’m not ashamed of the email we sent, then it’s working and likely to improve in the future.
* We can define other dates you take ownership of.
segments.sourceMdx:
- You introduce yourself (or your company’s employees), explain why you think you are a good fit.
- We run a test (paid), and assign you 2 test issues on our [newsletter calendar](https://thisweekinreact.com/calendar), weeks in advance.
- We do an onboarding call so that I can explain the process .
- I give you access to my curation tools to source links (RSS reader).
- We work collaboratively on the 1st test issue so that you get used to the process and understand the subtleties.
- You take full ownership of the 2nd test issue. I’ll answer questions and provide feedback, but you’ll do the majority of the work in autonomy.
- We review the work. It will never be perfect, but If I’m not ashamed of the email we sent, then it’s working and likely to improve in the future.
- We can define other dates you take ownership of.
segments.translated_content:
- 自我介绍（或介绍贵公司员工），说明为何认为自己是合适人选
- 进行付费测试，提前数周在[新闻简报日历](https://thisweekinreact.com/calendar)上分配2期测试内容
- 开展入职培训会议，由我讲解工作流程
- 授予我的内容聚合工具权限（RSS阅读器）
- 协作完成首期测试内容，帮助熟悉流程并理解细节要点
- 独立主导第二期测试内容。我会答疑并提供反馈，但主要工作需自主完成
- 审核成果。虽难臻完美，只要邮件质量达到可发布标准，即视为合格并具备提升空间
- 可协商确定后续负责的具体日期

segments.content: ## The process
segments.sourceMdx: ## The process
segments.translated_content: ## 工作流程

segments.content: **TLDR**: the newsletter curation process usually starts on Mondays, and we send the newsletter on Wednesdays evening (\~17h UTC - \~9am PST). You have the responsibility to ensure that the email is 100% ready to be sent on Wednesday. Usually, it takes \~16h of work in total, that you can eventually parallelize between 2 devs.
segments.sourceMdx: **TLDR**: the newsletter curation process usually starts on Mondays, and we send the newsletter on Wednesdays evening (\~17h UTC \- \~9am PST). You have the responsibility to ensure that the email is 100% ready to be sent on Wednesday. Usually, it takes \~16h of work in total, that you can eventually parallelize between 2 devs.
segments.translated_content: **简而言之**：每周一启动内容筛选，周三傍晚（约UTC17点/PST上午9点）发送简报。你需确保邮件在周三前完全就绪。通常总计需要约16小时工作量，可由2名开发者并行处理。

segments.content: **Main steps:**
segments.sourceMdx: **Main steps:**
segments.translated_content: **主要步骤**：

segments.content:
* Planning weeks in advance the issues you’ll take ownership of
* Sourcing roughly interesting links on X, RSS, web and organic sources
* Adding those links to a collaborative Google Docs
* Reviewing these links, formatting them and filtering uninteresting ones
* Commenting the most interesting links
* Selecting headlines
* Selecting a meme, preferably related to the news
* Creating a title with React / RN keywords
* Creating an intro text
* Converting to MDX
* Pushing to Git and publishing the online version
* Helping spread the word about the newsletter on social platforms
segments.sourceMdx:
- Planning weeks in advance the issues you’ll take ownership of
- Sourcing roughly interesting links on X, RSS, web and organic sources
- Adding those links to a collaborative Google Docs
- Reviewing these links, formatting them and filtering uninteresting ones
- Commenting the most interesting links
- Selecting headlines
- Selecting a meme, preferably related to the news
- Creating a title with React / RN keywords
- Creating an intro text
- Converting to MDX
- Pushing to Git and publishing the online version
- Helping spread the word about the newsletter on social platforms
segments.translated_content:
- 提前数周规划负责的期次
- 通过Twitter、RSS及自然渠道初步筛选内容
- 将候选链接添加至协作Google文档
- 复审链接，格式化并剔除低价值内容
- 对优质链接添加专业点评
- 选定头条新闻
- 挑选表情包（最好与当周新闻相关）
- 拟定含React/RN关键词的标题
- 撰写导语
- 转换为MDX格式
- 推送至Git并发布在线版
- 在社交平台协助推广

segments.content: **This remains under my responsibility:**
segments.sourceMdx: **This remains under my responsibility:**
segments.translated_content: **由我保留的职责**：

segments.content:
* Managing newsletter sponsors and ad placements
* Converting the web newsletter to the email version and hitting send
segments.sourceMdx:
- Managing newsletter sponsors and ad placements
- Converting the web newsletter to the email version and hitting send
segments.translated_content:
- 管理赞助商及广告位
- 将网页版转换为邮件格式并发送

segments.content: **To be defined:**
segments.sourceMdx: **To be defined:**
segments.translated_content: **待定事项**：

segments.content:
* Publishing a X thread or an article
* Publishing on Bluesky, Reddit, LinkedIn and other platforms
segments.sourceMdx:
- Publishing a X thread or an article
- Publishing on Bluesky, Reddit, LinkedIn and other platforms
segments.translated_content:
- 发布Twitter推文或文章
- 在Bluesky、Reddit、LinkedIn等平台分发

segments.content:
Months in advance, we look at the [newsletter public calendar](https://thisweekinreact.com/calendar) to define which dates you will contribute to.
Once we decide on a date, you become the planned author of this newsletter, and you **must book \~2 days of work** in your calendar to work on it.
segments.sourceMdx:
Months in advance, we look at the [newsletter public calendar](https://thisweekinreact.com/calendar) to define which dates you will contribute to.
Once we decide on a date, you become the planned author of this newsletter, and you **must book \~2 days of work** in your calendar to work on it.
segments.translated_content: 提前数月查看[公开日历](https://thisweekinreact.com/calendar)确定负责期次。确认日期后，你将成为该期指定作者，**必须预留约2个工作日**进行处理。

segments.content: ## Curation process
segments.sourceMdx: ## Curation process
segments.translated_content: ## 内容筛选流程

segments.content: The sourcing process is quite predictable:
segments.sourceMdx: The sourcing process is quite predictable:
segments.translated_content: 信息来源渠道可预测：

segments.content:
* Scroll the last 7 days on this [X chronological timeline](https://slo.im/x/feed) (bookmark the redirect `https://slo.im/x/feed`)
* Get access to my 500+ RSS feeds to monitor
segments.sourceMdx:
- Scroll the last 7 days on this [X chronological timeline](https://slo.im/x/feed) (bookmark the redirect `https://slo.im/x/feed`)
- Get access to my 500+ RSS feeds to monitor
segments.translated_content:
- 浏览[Twitter时间线](https://slo.im/x/feed)最近7天内容（收藏重定向链接`https://slo.im/x/feed`）
- 使用我500+个RSS订阅源监控

segments.content: You can also find interesting things your own way, organically or predictably, and help me refine this process over time. If you find interesting sources that we don’t track yet, we need to start tracking them.
segments.sourceMdx: You can also find interesting things your own way, organically or predictably, and help me refine this process over time. If you find interesting sources that we don’t track yet, we need to start tracking them.
segments.translated_content: 也可通过自有渠道发现优质内容，并协助持续优化流程。若发现未追踪的有价值信源，需及时添加。

segments.content: ## Editorial line
segments.sourceMdx: ## Editorial line
segments.translated_content: ## 编辑方针

segments.content: **General idea:**
segments.sourceMdx: **General idea:**
segments.translated_content: **核心理念**：

segments.content:
* For **mid/senior React and React Native dev**, but not limited to React links.
* **Fresh content**. 1 month is old already, we probably already covered it.
* **Weak signals** to understand what the future will look like.
* **Event-driven content**, such as a new release, a new project, a new docs page.
* Be the **pulse of the ecosystem** instead of being a discovery tool for all the React npm packages.
segments.sourceMdx:
- For **mid/senior React and React Native dev**, but not limited to React links.
- **Fresh content**. 1 month is old already, we probably already covered it.
- **Weak signals** to understand what the future will look like.
- **Event-driven content**, such as a new release, a new project, a new docs page.
- Be the **pulse of the ecosystem** instead of being a discovery tool for all the React npm packages.
segments.translated_content:
- 面向**中高级React/React Native开发者**，但不限于React相关内容
- **新鲜内容**。超过1个月的旧闻通常已覆盖
- **前沿动态**，预见技术发展趋势
- **事件驱动型内容**，如新版本发布、新项目、文档更新
- 成为**生态脉搏**，而非单纯的React npm包发现工具

segments.content: **What to prefer:**
segments.sourceMdx: **What to prefer:**
segments.translated_content: **优先考虑**：

segments.content:
* Content focusing on a **single idea** explaining a concept in **depth**.
* Content focusing on **React core techniques**, broadly applicable by a large audience.
* Content presenting **novel**, **innovative** or **underrated** techniques.
* Content covering **niche topics** and **weak signals** when presented well or impactful.
* Content with **outstanding presentation effort** and great **reading experience** such as interactive articles.
segments.sourceMdx:
- Content focusing on a **single idea** explaining a concept in **depth**.
- Content focusing on **React core techniques**, broadly applicable by a large audience.
- Content presenting **novel**, **innovative** or **underrated** techniques.
- Content covering **niche topics** and **weak signals** when presented well or impactful.
- Content with **outstanding presentation effort** and great **reading experience** such as interactive articles.
segments.translated_content:
- 聚焦于**单一理念**并**深度**阐释某个概念的优质内容
- 专注于**React核心技法**、能被广大开发者普遍应用的内容
- 呈现**新颖**、**创新**或**被低估**技术方案的内容
- 当呈现方式出色或影响深远时，涵盖**细分领域**和**弱信号**的内容
- 具有**卓越呈现力**和**绝佳阅读体验**的内容，例如交互式技术文章

segments.content: **What to avoid:**
segments.sourceMdx: **What to avoid:**
segments.translated_content: **需规避的内容：**

segments.content:
* Filter content produced by AI, for obvious SEO reasons, listicles, and other low-quality articles.
* Filter content behind a paywall, requiring auth or having a bad reading UX.
* Filter content for junior developers, basic 101s, step-by-step tutorials, paraphrasing official documentations with no added value.
* Filter content teaching how to use a paid product (we have sponsorships for that), unless it is not too promotional and teaches something valuable about React core along the way.
* Filter most UI libs and boilerplates, There simply are too many. The exception is when they prove high traction, a long-term maintenance commitment or come from an authority. We don’t cover “launches” for these but might cover v10 once it becomes mainstream and has proven its value to the community.
* Filter weak signals that are too weak: if you don’t even understand it, can’t explain its impact with simple words, or think only a dozen people will benefit from a link, maybe it’s too soon, or not worth including that link.
* Avoid X/Twitter thread/conversation links whenever possible: they require signups. Prefer external links. Eventually, individual tweets are fine if they contain all the information, a link, or a video demo.
segments.sourceMdx:
- Filter content produced by AI, for obvious SEO reasons, listicles, and other low-quality articles.
- Filter content behind a paywall, requiring auth or having a bad reading UX.
- Filter content for junior developers, basic 101s, step-by-step tutorials, paraphrasing official documentations with no added value.
- Filter content teaching how to use a paid product (we have sponsorships for that), unless it is not too promotional and teaches something valuable about React core along the way.
- Filter most UI libs and boilerplates, There simply are too many. The exception is when they prove high traction, a long-term maintenance commitment or come from an authority. We don’t cover “launches” for these but might cover v10 once it becomes mainstream and has proven its value to the community.
- Filter weak signals that are too weak: if you don’t even understand it, can’t explain its impact with simple words, or think only a dozen people will benefit from a link, maybe it’s too soon, or not worth including that link.
- Avoid X/Twitter thread/conversation links whenever possible: they require signups. Prefer external links. Eventually, individual tweets are fine if they contain all the information, a link, or a video demo.
segments.translated_content:
- 因SEO问题需过滤AI生成内容、清单式文章及其他低质量内容
- 过滤存在付费墙、需登录认证或阅读体验差的内容
- 过滤面向初级开发者的基础教程、步骤指南、对官方文档无价值重述的内容
- 过滤教授付费产品使用的教程（我们有赞助渠道处理这类需求），除非其非过度营销且能同步传授有价值的React核心技术
- 过滤大多数UI库和样板代码。例外情况是：当它们展现出高关注度、长期维护承诺或出自权威来源时。我们通常不报道这些工具的"首发"，但可能在v10版本成为主流并证明社区价值后进行报道
- 过滤过于微弱的弱信号：若您自身都难以理解该内容、无法用简练语言解释其影响、或认为仅少数人受益，则可能时机未到或价值不足
- 尽可能避免X/Twitter话题链接（需登录）。优先选用站外链接。但包含完整信息、外链或视频演示的独立推文仍可选用

segments.content: Exceptions can always be made for content with an outstanding presentation effort. An interactive article explaining basic React concepts is fine for example: it’s a great resource our target audience (senior devs) might share with their junior colleagues.
segments.sourceMdx: Exceptions can always be made for content with an outstanding presentation effort. An interactive article explaining basic React concepts is fine for example: it’s a great resource our target audience (senior devs) might share with their junior colleagues.
segments.translated_content: 对于呈现形式卓越的内容可破例采纳。例如解释React基础概念的交互式文章：这是目标受众（资深开发者）可能分享给初级同事的优质资源

segments.content: ## Content
segments.sourceMdx: ## Content
segments.translated_content: ## 内容规范

segments.content:
The newsletter contains a lot of links, because the React ecosystem is thriving.
Instead of filtering links more aggressively, we optimize for providing a good reading experience despite the information density.
The content should be consistent, easy to scan, and information should be “inlined” whenever possible.
We don't want to bait someone into clicking on a link and then disappoint them.
Reading the newsletter should provide value despite not clicking a single link.
segments.sourceMdx:
The newsletter contains a lot of links, because the React ecosystem is thriving.
Instead of filtering links more aggressively, we optimize for providing a good reading experience despite the information density.
The content should be consistent, easy to scan, and information should be “inlined” whenever possible.
We don't want to bait someone into clicking on a link and then disappoint them.
Reading the newsletter should provide value despite not clicking a single link.
segments.translated_content:
鉴于React生态的繁荣，简报会包含大量链接。
我们不是通过更严格过滤链接，而是优化高信息密度下的阅读体验。
内容应保持一致性、便于速览，并尽可能采用"内联"信息呈现方式。
要避免诱导点击却令人失望的链接。
即使读者不点击任何链接，阅读简报本身也应获得价值。

segments.content: ### Sections
segments.sourceMdx: ### Sections
segments.translated_content: ### 板块划分

segments.content: The newsletter has 5 main sections:
segments.sourceMdx: The newsletter has 5 main sections:
segments.translated_content: 简报包含5个主要板块：

segments.content:
* Intro: a small recap of the news
* React: for content relevant to all React devs, and React web devs
* React Native: for content relevant to React Native devs
* Other: for content relevant to a broader JS audience, including TS, CSS, TC39, HTML, tooling and more
* Fun: 1-3 memes or fun screenshots, preferably related to React (private joke) and the news of the current week.
segments.sourceMdx:
- Intro: a small recap of the news
- React: for content relevant to all React devs, and React web devs
- React Native: for content relevant to React Native devs
- Other: for content relevant to a broader JS audience, including TS, CSS, TC39, HTML, tooling and more
- Fun: 1-3 memes or fun screenshots, preferably related to React (private joke) and the news of the current week.
segments.translated_content:
- 导读：本周要闻摘要
- React板块：面向所有React开发者及Web开发者的相关内容
- React Native板块：面向React Native开发者的相关内容
- 其他板块：面向更广泛JS受众的内容，含TS/CSS/TC39/HTML/工具链等
- 趣味板块：1-3个meme或趣味截图，优先选择与React（内部梗）及本周新闻相关的素材

segments.content: ### Headlines
segments.sourceMdx: ### Headlines
segments.translated_content: ### 头条选取

segments.content: We usually pick:
segments.sourceMdx: We usually pick:
segments.translated_content: 常规选择标准：

segments.content:
* 1 React headline
* 1 React Native headline
segments.sourceMdx:
- 1 React headline
- 1 React Native headline
segments.translated_content:
- 1条React头条
- 1条React Native头条

segments.content:
Each headline usually has a top banner image.
It’s preferable to pick one that represents something meaningful visually (such as a code screenshot) but a beautiful social card is ok too.
segments.sourceMdx:
Each headline usually has a top banner image.
It’s preferable to pick one that represents something meaningful visually (such as a code screenshot) but a beautiful social card is ok too.
segments.translated_content:
每条头条通常配有顶部横幅图。
优先选择具有视觉意义的内容（如代码截图），精美的社交卡片图亦可接受。

segments.content:
Sometimes there is no clear headline for a section, sometimes there are 2.
Sometimes we pick a headline for the Other section.
segments.sourceMdx:
Sometimes there is no clear headline for a section, sometimes there are 2\.
Sometimes we pick a headline for the Other section.
segments.translated_content:
有时某个板块没有明确头条，有时则可能出现双头条。
偶尔我们会为"其他"板块选取头条。

segments.content: ### Formatting
segments.sourceMdx: ### Formatting
segments.translated_content: ### 格式规范

segments.content: All links usually follow the following convention for most links:
segments.sourceMdx: All links usually follow the following convention for most links:
segments.translated_content: 所有链接遵循基本格式：

segments.content: * \<Emoji> [Link title](https://example.com): Optional subjective comment.
segments.sourceMdx: - \<Emoji\> [Link title](https://example.com): Optional subjective comment.
segments.translated_content: - \<表情符号\> [链接标题](https://example.com)：可选的编者主观评注

segments.content: If a title is too long, click-baity or weirdly capitalized, feel free to refactor it so that all titles are relatively consistent.
segments.sourceMdx: If a title is too long, click-baity or weirdly capitalized, feel free to refactor it so that all titles are relatively consistent.
segments.translated_content: 若原标题过长、存在点击诱导或大小写混乱，可重构标题以保持整体一致性

segments.content: For releases, we drop the “v” and the patch number (3.1, not v3.1.9). Include the major release highlight keywords directly in the link, separated with a dash `-`. Don’t include a release if there’s nothing interesting to highlight, which is often the case for patch releases. What’s “inside” the link is the “objective” part (the highlights), what’s “outside” is your subjective comment (if any). Examples:
segments.sourceMdx: For releases, we drop the “v” and the patch number (3.1, not v3.1.9). Include the major release highlight keywords directly in the link, separated with a dash `-`. Don’t include a release if there’s nothing interesting to highlight, which is often the case for patch releases. What’s “inside” the link is the “objective” part (the highlights), what’s “outside” is your subjective comment (if any). Examples:
segments.translated_content: 对于版本发布，我们省略"v"前缀和补丁版本号（例如3.1，而非v3.1.9）。在链接标题中用短横线`-`分隔主要版本的关键特性。若补丁版本没有值得关注的更新（通常如此），则不予收录。链接内的内容是"客观"部分（特性说明），链接外的则是您的主观评论（如有）。示例：

segments.content:
* 📦 [Astro 5.2 - Tailwind 4 support, trailing slash redirects, option to disable React streaming](https://astro.build/blog/astro-520/): Streaming might be incompatible with runtime CSS-in-JS libraries.
* 📦 [Nextra 4.0 - Now using App Router](https://the-guild.dev/blog/nextra-4)
* 📦 [React Scan 0.1.2 - Re-render history, components tree](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.1.2)
segments.sourceMdx:
- 📦 [Astro 5.2 \- Tailwind 4 support, trailing slash redirects, option to disable React streaming](https://astro.build/blog/astro-520/): Streaming might be incompatible with runtime CSS-in-JS libraries.
- 📦 [Nextra 4.0 \- Now using App Router](https://the-guild.dev/blog/nextra-4)
- 📦 [React Scan 0.1.2 \- Re-render history, components tree](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.1.2)
segments.translated_content:
- 📦 [Astro 5.2 - Tailwind 4支持、尾部斜杠重定向、禁用React流式渲染选项](https://astro.build/blog/astro-520/)：流式渲染可能与运行时CSS-in-JS库不兼容
- 📦 [Nextra 4.0 - 现已采用App Router](https://the-guild.dev/blog/nextra-4)
- 📦 [React Scan 0.1.2 - 重渲染历史记录、组件树](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.1.2)

segments.content: If it’s a rather new project featured for the first time, you can avoid the version number, and replace keywords by an objective project description (inspired by GitHub repo description, landing page, SEO tags):
segments.sourceMdx: If it’s a rather new project featured for the first time, you can avoid the version number, and replace keywords by an objective project description (inspired by GitHub repo description, landing page, SEO tags):
segments.translated_content: 若是首次收录的新项目，可省略版本号，用客观的项目描述替代关键词（参考GitHub仓库说明、落地页或SEO标签）：

segments.content:
* 📦 [Polygen - Run WebAssembly modules in your apps, statically, without interpreting](https://github.com/callstackincubator/polygen): This Callstack package in preview converts Wasm to C and then call it through JSI to deliver great performance.
* 📦 [React Three Handles](https://pmndrs.github.io/xr/docs/handles/introduction): A new convenient package to build React XR interactions.
* 📦 [mdx-prompt - Composable LLM Prompts with JSX](https://edspencer.net/2025/2/3/mdx-prompt-composable-prompts-with-jsx)
segments.sourceMdx:
- 📦 [Polygen \- Run WebAssembly modules in your apps, statically, without interpreting](https://github.com/callstackincubator/polygen): This Callstack package in preview converts Wasm to C and then call it through JSI to deliver great performance.
- 📦 [React Three Handles](https://pmndrs.github.io/xr/docs/handles/introduction): A new convenient package to build React XR interactions.
- 📦 [mdx-prompt \- Composable LLM Prompts with JSX](https://edspencer.net/2025/2/3/mdx-prompt-composable-prompts-with-jsx)
segments.translated_content:
- 📦 [Polygen - 在应用中静态运行WebAssembly模块，无需解释器](https://github.com/callstackincubator/polygen)：Callstack的预览版工具，通过将Wasm转为C代码并通过JSI调用以实现卓越性能
- 📦 [React Three Handles](https://pmndrs.github.io/xr/docs/handles/introduction)：构建React XR交互的新工具包
- 📦 [mdx-prompt - 使用JSX组合式LLM提示词](https://edspencer.net/2025/2/3/mdx-prompt-composable-prompts-with-jsx)

segments.content: Here’s the emoji palette we generally use
segments.sourceMdx: Here’s the emoji palette we generally use
segments.translated_content: 这是我们常用的表情符号分类：

segments.content:
* 💸: sponsors
* 👀: preview, PR, weak signals
* 💬: RFC, community discussion
* 📊: survey, benchmark
* 💡: interesting idea
* 📖: docs
* 🦋: Bluesky links
* 🐦: Twitter/X links (avoid if possible)
* 🎨: visual demos (posted outside X)
* 📅: events, conference partnerships
* 📜: articles
* 📦: releases, npm packages plugins, repositories
* 🔗: resources
* 🎥: videos
* 🎙️: podcasts
segments.sourceMdx:
- 💸: sponsors
- 👀: preview, PR, weak signals
- 💬: RFC, community discussion
- 📊: survey, benchmark
- 💡: interesting idea
- 📖: docs
- 🦋: Bluesky links
- 🐦: Twitter/X links (avoid if possible)
- 🎨: visual demos (posted outside X)
- 📅: events, conference partnerships
- 📜: articles
- 📦: releases, npm packages plugins, repositories
- 🔗: resources
- 🎥: videos
- 🎙️: podcasts
segments.translated_content:
- 💸：赞助内容
- 👀：预览、PR、弱信号
- 💬：RFC、社区讨论
- 📊：调研、基准测试
- 💡：有趣创意
- 📖：文档
- 🦋：Bluesky链接
- 🐦：Twitter/X链接（尽量避免）
- 🎨：视觉演示（非X平台发布）
- 📅：活动、会议合作
- 📜：文章
- 📦：版本发布、npm包/插件/代码库
- 🔗：资源
- 🎥：视频
- 🎙️：播客

segments.content: We usually respect more or less this “emoji ordering”, leading to a consistent reading order:
segments.sourceMdx: We usually respect more or less this “emoji ordering”, leading to a consistent reading order:
segments.translated_content: 我们通常遵循以下"表情符号排序"，形成一致的阅读顺序：

segments.content:
* headlines
* weak signals
* community articles
* media resources
segments.sourceMdx:
- headlines
- weak signals
- community articles
- media resources
segments.translated_content:
- 头条新闻
- 弱信号
- 社区文章
- 媒体资源

segments.content: Example:
segments.sourceMdx: Example:
segments.translated_content: 示例：

segments.content:
* 💸 [Add a collaborative document editor to your app](https://convex.link/0dtC5qE)
* 👀 [Remix PR - Split Route Modules](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11871): Introduce new `future.unstable_splitRouteModules` flag so that the route component and its clientLoader can be downloaded in parallel instead of sequentially.
* 🗓️ [Paris TypeScript La Conf'](https://la-conf.typescript.paris/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - 🇫🇷 Paris - 28 February - Last call to join the first ever TypeScript conference in the heart of Paris! Get 20% off tickets with code "TWIR"!
* 📖 [Integrate Motion with Radix](https://motion.dev/docs/radix): New docs page presenting integration examples for exit and layout animations.
* 📜 [Single Responsibility Principle in React: The Art of Component Focus](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/single-responsibility-principle-in-react/): I agree with this practice of designing your React app in “layers”.
* 📜 [Persisting Form Data in React: A Modern Approach with Nuqs](https://armand-salle.fr/post/persisting-form-data-in-react-a-modern-approach-with-nuqs/): Introduces a convenient lib to use search parameters in a typesafe way with integrations for Next.js and React Router.
* 📦 [Astro 5.2 - Tailwind 4 support, trailing slash redirects, option to disable React streaming](https://astro.build/blog/astro-520/): Streaming might be incompatible with runtime CSS-in-JS libraries.
* 📦 [React Scan 0.1.2 - Re-render history, components tree](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.1.2)
* 🎥 [Theo - Create React App is finally dead](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aujVi7ipkfM)
* 🎥 [Jack Herrington - Stop Using Recoil, Use This Instead!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QepeuHTxiLo)
* 🎙️ [This Month in React 2025-01 - Movement on CRA, Redwood.js dead?](https://open.spotify.com/episode/45LTSjvCA5k5YAC7EM4ixk)
segments.sourceMdx:
- 💸 [Add a collaborative document editor to your app](https://convex.link/0dtC5qE)
- 👀 [Remix PR \- Split Route Modules](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11871): Introduce new `future.unstable_splitRouteModules` flag so that the route component and its clientLoader can be downloaded in parallel instead of sequentially.
- 🗓️ [Paris TypeScript La Conf'](https://la-conf.typescript.paris/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) \- 🇫🇷 Paris \- 28 February \- Last call to join the first ever TypeScript conference in the heart of Paris\! Get 20% off tickets with code "TWIR"\!
- 📖 [Integrate Motion with Radix](https://motion.dev/docs/radix): New docs page presenting integration examples for exit and layout animations.
- 📜 [Single Responsibility Principle in React: The Art of Component Focus](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/single-responsibility-principle-in-react/): I agree with this practice of designing your React app in “layers”.
- 📜 [Persisting Form Data in React: A Modern Approach with Nuqs](https://armand-salle.fr/post/persisting-form-data-in-react-a-modern-approach-with-nuqs/): Introduces a convenient lib to use search parameters in a typesafe way with integrations for Next.js and React Router.
- 📦 [Astro 5.2 \- Tailwind 4 support, trailing slash redirects, option to disable React streaming](https://astro.build/blog/astro-520/): Streaming might be incompatible with runtime CSS-in-JS libraries.
- 📦 [React Scan 0.1.2 \- Re-render history, components tree](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.1.2)
- 🎥 [Theo \- Create React App is finally dead](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aujVi7ipkfM)
- 🎥 [Jack Herrington \- Stop Using Recoil, Use This Instead\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QepeuHTxiLo)
- 🎙️ [This Month in React 2025-01 \- Movement on CRA, Redwood.js dead?](https://open.spotify.com/episode/45LTSjvCA5k5YAC7EM4ixk)
segments.translated_content:
- 💸 [为你的应用添加协作文档编辑器](https://convex.link/0dtC5qE)
- 👀 [Remix PR - 拆分路由模块](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/11871): 引入新的 `future.unstable_splitRouteModules` 标志，使路由组件及其 clientLoader 可以并行下载而非串行加载。
- 🗓️ [巴黎 TypeScript 大会](https://la-conf.typescript.paris/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - 🇫🇷 巴黎 - 2月28日 - 首届巴黎核心区TypeScript大会最后召集！使用优惠码"TWIR"可享门票8折！
- 📖 [将Motion与Radix集成](https://motion.dev/docs/radix): 新增文档页面展示退出动画和布局动画的集成示例。
- 📜 [React中的单一职责原则：组件聚焦的艺术](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/single-responsibility-principle-in-react/): 我赞同这种将React应用设计为"分层"结构的实践。
- 📜 [React表单数据持久化：基于Nuqs的现代方案](https://armand-salle.fr/post/persisting-form-data-in-react-a-modern-approach-with-nuqs/): 介绍了一个便捷库，可通过类型安全方式使用搜索参数，并集成了Next.js和React Router。
- 📦 [Astro 5.2 - 支持Tailwind 4、尾部斜杠重定向、禁用React流式传输选项](https://astro.build/blog/astro-520/): 流式传输可能与运行时CSS-in-JS库不兼容。
- 📦 [React Scan 0.1.2 - 重渲染历史记录、组件树](https://github.com/aidenybai/react-scan/releases/tag/v0.1.2)
- 🎥 [Theo - Create React App终于寿终正寝](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aujVi7ipkfM)
- 🎥 [Jack Herrington - 停止使用Recoil，改用这个！](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QepeuHTxiLo)
- 🎙️ [2025年1月React月报 - CRA动态，Redwood.js已死？](https://open.spotify.com/episode/45LTSjvCA5k5YAC7EM4ixk)

segments.content: ### Comments
segments.sourceMdx: ### Comments
segments.translated_content: ### 评论规范

segments.content: Some general rules to follow:
segments.sourceMdx: Some general rules to follow:
segments.translated_content: 需遵循的基本原则：

segments.content:
* It’s not needed to comment on everything.
* For a given emoji, what we comment usually appears first.
* It's better not to comment on something than to make the wrong comment.
* Comments have to be concise and to the point.
* Use a simple language.
* Don’t add useless fluff words.
segments.sourceMdx:
- It’s not needed to comment on everything.
- For a given emoji, what we comment usually appears first.
- It's better not to comment on something than to make the wrong comment.
- Comments have to be concise and to the point.
- Use a simple language.
- Don’t add useless fluff words.
segments.translated_content:
- 无需对每个条目都添加评论
- 同类emoji条目中，评论通常出现在首个条目
- 宁可保持沉默也不要发表不当评论
- 评论需简明扼要
- 使用简洁语言
- 避免无意义的修饰词

segments.content: ## Conclusion
segments.sourceMdx: ## Conclusion
segments.translated_content: ## 结语

segments.content:
Yes, this is a serious job that takes a lot of time.
I hope you’ll be interested to help me!
segments.sourceMdx:
Yes, this is a serious job that takes a lot of time.
I hope you’ll be interested to help me\!
segments.translated_content:
是的，这是一项需要投入大量时间的严肃工作。
期待您能加入协助！

segments.content: Contact me at [sebastien@thisweekinreact.com](mailto:sebastien@thisweekinreact.com)
segments.sourceMdx: Contact me at sebastien@thisweekinreact.com
segments.translated_content: 联系邮箱：sebastien@thisweekinreact.com
